employer_name: Talent Acquisitions Group Inc - Executive Search Firm
job_description:
Title: Business Development Manager

Location: REMOTE

Industry: Private Equity | Portfolio Companies

Compensation:
• Highly competitive compensation package
• 1099 contractor for the first year.

The ideal candidate has sourcing and/or recruiting experience, as well as proven success in the Talent Acquisition/Staffing industry selling to HR and Talent Acquisition leaders. They have a history of proven success with building and scaling a business development function and driving revenue growth.

Position Overview

The Business Development Manager will have 3 main priorities:
• building and scaling the Business Development function
• driving revenue growth
• acquiring new logos and closing new business.

They are a strategic sales professional, with a hunter mentality and a history of success in full-cycle sales roles. The Business Development Manager will be responsible for the entire sales cycle, from prospecting to closing new business and everything in between.

Lead Responsibilities
• Identify, prioritize, and initiate business development opportunities
• Own the entire sales cycle from prospecting to closing and everything in between
• Collaborate with the team to develop branding, social media, and marketing strategies to help increase brand awareness and drive revenue growth
• Act as the main point of contact for potential clients throughout the sales process from initial contact to closing
• Develop and nurture client relationships throughout the sales process
• Scheduling meetings with potential clients
• Conduct in-depth client needs assessments to understand their staffing requirements, identify pain points, and present tailored solutions to address their hiring challenges.
• Building a strong pipeline of qualified leads through effective prospecting, outreach, networking, and leveraging social media platforms
• Demonstrate a deep understanding of the talent acquisition industry, market trends, and client pain points to effectively communicate our unique value proposition.
• Collaborate closely with the internal recruitment team to gather insights on industry-specific talent demands and ensure a quick turnaround to fulfill client requirements.
• Regularly update the CRM system with accurate client information, prospecting activities, sales activities, and progress toward hitting targets.
• Meet and exceed monthly and quarterly sales targets, KPIs, and metrics.

Desired Qualities, Skills, and Experience
• Experience sourcing and/or recruiting in a talent acquisition or staffing role
• Experience collaborating with HR, People, and Talent Acquisition Managers and Leaders
• Experience selling to Human Resources, People, and/or Talent Acquisition Leaders
• Experience in a business development role at a staffing agency or recruiting firm
• History of success in full-cycle sales roles
• Proven success with building and scaling a business development function
• Proven history of meeting and exceeding KPIs, sales, and revenue goals
• Growth mindset and positive mental attitude
• Creative and out-of-the-box thinker who is motivated by challenges
• Not afraid to pick up the phone and cold call potential clients
• Not afraid to experiment with using creative and potentially out-of-the-box approaches to book meetings with qualified decision-makers and close new business
• Adaptable and able to work independently in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
• Passionate about recruiting and talent acquisition
• Experience using ZoomInfo, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, CRMs, ATS systems, MixMax, Zoom, Google Workspace, and Calendly
• Exceptional interpersonal, negotiation, creative problem-solving, research, oral, and written communication skills
• Exceptional time management and organizational skills
• Able to confidently and skillfully engage with potential clients at all levels of seniority
• Preferred but not required experience working with Private Equity portfolio companies, sourcing or recruiting for them
• Preferred but not required experience selling to HR and TA leaders at Private Equity portfolio companies

Responsibilities: The Business Development Manager will have 3 main priorities:
building and scaling the Business Development function
The Business Development Manager will be responsible for the entire sales cycle, from prospecting to closing new business and everything in between
Identify, prioritize, and initiate business development opportunities
Collaborate with the team to develop branding, social media, and marketing strategies to help increase brand awareness and drive revenue growth

Conduct in-depth client needs assessments to understand their staffing requirements, identify pain points, and present tailored solutions to address their hiring challenges
